title: Baked Sweet Potatoes Recipe
description: This baked sweet potato recipe cooks perfectly seasoned cubes of sweet potato until tender with crispy edges for an easy and delicious side dish.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Side Dish Vegetables Sweet Potatoes Baked Sweet Potatoes 4.7 (699) 510 Reviews 59 Photos These baked sweet potato cubes, seasoned with olive oil and oregano, make a delicious side dish. The whole family enjoys eating sweet potato when I make this recipe! Submitted by JENNCOOK Updated on October 4, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 59 59 59 59 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 45 mins Total Time: 1 hr Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe These baked sweet potato cubes will pair perfectly with all your favorite seasonal dinners.  How to Bake Sweet Potatoes You'll find a detailed ingredient list and step-by-step instructions in the recipe below, but let's go over the basics: How to Season Sweet Potatoes These baked sweet potatoes are simply seasoned with dried oregano, salt, and pepper. Of course, you can flavor them however you like.  How to Bake Sweet Potatoes At Home Here’s a brief overview of what you can expect when you bake sweet potatoes at home: Wash and peel the sweet potatoes, then cut them into cubes. Place in a prepared baking dish, coat with oil, and season. Bake in the preheated oven until soft and fork-tender How Long to Bake Sweet Potatoes In an oven preheated to 350 degrees F, three large cubed sweet potatoes should be perfectly baked and fork-tender in about 45 minutes.  Can You Make This Recipe Ahead of Time?  You can wash, peel, and cube the sweet potatoes the day before you plan to serve the baked sweet potatoes to save time. Simply store the cubed sweet potatoes in an airtight container in the refrigerator. How to Store Baked Sweet Potatoes You can store leftover baked sweet potato cubes in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to five days.  Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise “Absolutely delicious sweet potato recipe,” raves Bob Seale. “I roasted them on a prepared baking sheet and turned them over half way through to crisp them. Just before serving, I squeezed a few drops of fresh lemon juice over them.” “So simple!” according to Mary Delaney. "Crisp and chewy corners, perfectly soft inside. This is going to be a regular in our vegetable rotation.” “So easy to make,” says linda. “I didn't have oregano so I used Herbs de Provence. Will definitely make it again!” Editorial contributions by Corey Williams Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 2 tablespoons olive oil 3 large sweet potatoes 2 pinches dried oregano or to taste 2 pinches salt 2 pinches ground black pepper Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Coat the bottom of a glass or nonstick baking dish with olive oil, just enough to coat. Wash and peel sweet potatoes; cut into medium pieces. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Place in the baking dish and stir to coat with olive oil. Sprinkle with oregano, salt, and pepper. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bake in the preheated oven until soft and fork-tender, about 45 minutes to 1 hour. Enjoy! DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  I Made It Print 1,169 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Baked Sweet Potatoes 01 of 59 Photo by  DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  02 of 59 Photo by  KindScoop5258 06/16/2023 I made it for the first time tonight for myself and my daughter, and it was absolutely amazing. We both loved it. I made it exactly how the recipe is written, Delish!!! If I could give it 10 stars, I would!! I forgot to take a picture when it was in the baking dish, but here’s a picture of the leftovers (not much left over since it was SO GOOD!!) 03 of 59 Photo by  tompat 10/30/2022 Super recipe 04 of 59 Photo by  Patrice F. 05/14/2021 05 of 59 Photo by  Cynthia Thompson 04/26/2021 06 of 59 Photo by  ph2072 04/05/2021 Made tonight, exactly as written in the instructions. Really good and a nice, simple go-to recipe for the future. Seems healthy too. 07 of 59 Photo by  linda 02/16/2021 08 of 59 Photo by  linda 02/16/2021 09 of 59 Photo by  John Hammers 01/26/2020 I cooked mine about 20 minutes longer to crisp up some of the potatoes. And who knew that oregano went with sweet potatoes? 10 of 59 Photo by  Gabby 01/09/2020 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Baked Sweet Potato Sticks 476 Ratings Green Beans with Hazelnuts and Lemon 120 Ratings Zucchini Saute 182 Ratings Homemade Pumpkin Puree 205 Ratings Zucchini with Chickpea and Mushroom Stuffing 179 Ratings Grilled Asparagus 868 Ratings Barley and Mushrooms with Beans 148 Ratings Tomato Cucumber Salad 159 Ratings Sean's Mommy's Roasted Root Vegetables 62 Ratings Sugar Snap Peas with Mint 157 Ratings Carrot, Tomato, and Spinach Quinoa Pilaf 97 Ratings Roasted Eggplant and Mushrooms 55 Ratings Roasted Beets 'n Sweets 791 Ratings Sesame Broccoli 112 Ratings Asparagus with Tomatoes 73 Ratings Baked Sweet Potatoes with Ginger and Honey 193 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: JENNCOOK
instructions: Wash and peel the sweet potatoes, then cut them into cubes.;Place in a prepared baking dish, coat with oil, and season.;Bake in the preheated oven until soft and fork-tender;Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Coat the bottom of a glass or nonstick baking dish with olive oil, just enough to coat.;Wash and peel sweet potatoes; cut into medium pieces. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Place in the baking dish and stir to coat with olive oil. Sprinkle with oregano, salt, and pepper. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Bake in the preheated oven until soft and fork-tender, about 45 minutes to 1 hour.;Enjoy! DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS
